main event: A witness reported seeing a brilliant white light that was pink at two extremes, moving from west to east over Pleasant Valley, Ohio on March 6, 1968.
interesting points: The object was visible for 4-5 minutes.
The witness described the object as a solid, sharply outlined light that was brighter than the brightest stars.
The witness was unable to estimate the speed or distance of the object.
The witness reported that the object appeared to stand still at times and suddenly speed up and rush away.
The witness was requested to complete a form 117 but refused to return it.
sighted object: a brilliant white light that was pink at two extremes
